newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Yanacocha five-month gold output up 25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Yanacocha five-month gold output up 25 pct.

text.p: Peru's largest gold miner Minera Yanacocha S.A. produced 12.22 tonnes in the first five months of 1997, up 25 percent compared with the same period last year, the government said Friday.

Yanacocha, a joint venture run by Newmont Mining Corp in the northern Peruvian Andes, accounted for 43 percent of total national output of 28.43 tonnes in the first five months of the year, according to preliminary Energy and Mines Ministry figures.
That total output included an estimated 8.8 million tonnes produced by informal gold miners, mainly in Peru's southeastern jungle, southern coast and northeastern Andes.

Yanacocha is owned by partners Newmont and local firm Cia. Minera Buenaventura S.A.. The firm produces gold through heap-leaching operations at its open-pit mines in highland Cajamarca department some 375 miles (600 km) north of Lima.
Peru's second highest gold-producing company in the first five months was locally-owned Aurifera Retamas with 1.80 tonnes, up 18.34 percent on its production in the same period last year.
